page.title: 13LANDSCAPE
page.content: Braceby is situated on top of a small ridge called the Lincolnshire cliff and the buildings are interspersed by numerous trees. Boundaries are mainly of mixed hedging and dry stone walls and the surrounding fields are mainly arable. Buildings,apart from housing, include a Norman church,two dovecotes the old carpenters shop, old blacksmiths forge and numerous barns. { Ten buildings are listed}as being of{architectural interest together with a 19 century water pump. These buildings include the church, the working farm, two other farm- houses, two cottages, two barns and one dovecote. All buildings apart from one cottage are built of local lime- stone with pantiled roofs. The church is 12th century much altered over the years. it still has it{medieval bell.
